education.description: Learned Full Stack Web Development by studying, writing, and troubleshooting code. Completed 3 team projects and learned how to effectively coordinate my coding remotely with others through the use of Git Repo's. Every week of the boot camp required me to produce a new application that utilized industry technologies. As a student, I learned how to code both the front-end and back-end of web applications.
Strong focus on math (CALC 3), physics (PHY 2), and Javascript.

Learned the basics of web design, networking, C++ and Javascript. The academy placed me at an internship with KONTEK Systems where I installed network systems for Universities, Hospitals, and Libraries.

work.title: Fleet Mechanic
work.description: Maintained a fleet of 30 buses and 150 automobiles. Repairs were done in the field (where breakdowns occured) in order to make sure the students safely arrived to their destinations. This environment required consistent critical thinking under pressure. I had to make timely repair decisions, order my own parts, and coordinate when to bring buses out of service to perform repairs.

work.title: Fleet Mechanic
work.description: I manage a fleet of commercial trucks and heavy equipment (excavators, dozers, and things of that sort.) I Coordinate closely with another mechanic to complete the maximum amount of repairs on the fleet. Communication and teamwork has been a great success in this position.

work.company: Americorps: Habitat for Humanity and Residential Services Inc
work.title: Community Organizer and Social Worker
work.description: Managed a variety of philanthropic projects for non-profit businesses including Habitat for Humanity, Public Allies of North Carolina, and Residential Services Inc. Practiced community organizing, team leadership, and asset based community development. At Habitat for Humanity, our goal was to provide low income housing. At RSI, our goal was to provide living options and related supports to people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

projects.title: Bus Tracker
projects.description: Tracks buses, students, and bus breakdowns. Alerts the user when there is any problem with student pickup.

projects.title: Pick Your Poison
projects.description: The idea of Pick Your Poison is simple - to provide a quick drink recommendation and recipe based on your local weather.

projects.title: Employee Management
projects.description: Demonstrates how MySQL can manage a database of company employees, managers, and departments. SQL commands and seeds are in Develop/db.

projects.title: Workday Planner
projects.description: Implements MomentJS and Local Storage to create a daily planner. Timeblocks change color in relation to the hours of the workday.

projects.title: Commerce DataBase
projects.description: This project replicates an Internet Retailer. I constructed a back end that uses Express.js API, Sequelize, and MySQL database.

projects.title: API Weather
projects.description: API calls retrieve current weather conditions and a 6 day forecast. Javascript parses the object data for use

projects.title: Tech Blog
projects.description: The Tech Blog uses a RESTful CRUD to manage a public forum. It allows users to sign-up/login. It uses an MVC format via Handlebars.

projects.title: Coding Quiz
projects.description: This is a fun and simple quiz that uses Javascript to ask multiple choice questions about coding. It records the users top score.

projects.title: Note Taker
projects.description: A user can create, save, and delete notes. The application uses a JSON file to save the user's notes.
